CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 29, 1955, pg. A8 reads: "NAACP Protest Rally : 3,000 Hear Emmett Till Case Facts; Give; Urge United States to Act - To Ask FBI - "We mean to call the Attorney General and J. Edgar Hoover to explain why the Federal Government never has made an arrest in Georgia, Mississippi, and other places in South where a white man has taken the life of a Negro," exclaims Dr. T.R.M. Howard.
TitMainTitle: Dr. T. R. M. Howard speaking at podium in Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall, with Helen Howard, Rev. LeRoy Patrick, and Jessie Vann seated on stage behind him, and Judge Henry Smith, Jim Jordon and Everett Utterback Sr. in background, for NAACP protest rally

(Theodore Roosevelt Mason), 1908-1976
